remarks: Group homomorphisms preserve division.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 16-Jun-2011.)
statement:
ghomdiv.1 $e |- X = ran G $.
ghomdiv.2 $e |- D = ( /g ` G ) $.
ghomdiv.3 $e |- C = ( /g ` H ) $.
ghomdiv $p |- ( ( ( G e. GrpOp /\ H e. GrpOp /\ F e. ( G GrpOpHom H ) ) /\ ( A e. X /\ B e. X ) ) -> ( F ` ( A D B ) ) = ( ( F ` A ) C ( F ` B ) ) ) $.
